Provides voice related QMI based Sierra functions. More...

Enumerations

enum  eQMI_CALL_STATES {
  CALL_STATE_ORIGINATION = 0x01, CALL_STATE_INCOMING = 0x02, CALL_STATE_CONVERSATION = 0x03, CALL_STATE_CC_IN_PROGRESS = 0x04,
  CALL_STATE_ALERTING = 0x05, CALL_STATE_HOLD = 0x06, CALL_STATE_WAITING = 0x07, CALL_STATE_DISCONNECTING = 0x08,
  CALL_STATE_END = 0x09, CALL_STATE_SETUP = 0x0A, CALL_STATE_UNAVAILABLE = 0xFF
}
enum  eQMI_CALL_DIRECTION { CALL_DIRECTION_MO = 0x01, CALL_DIRECTION_MT = 0x02 }
enum  eQMI_CALL_MODE {
  CALL_MODE_CDMA = 0x01, CALL_MODE_GSM = 0x02, CALL_MODE_UMTS = 0x03, CALL_MODE_LTE = 0x04,
  CALL_MODE_TDS = 0x05, CALL_MODE_UNAVALABLE = 0xFF
}
enum  eQMI_VOICE_PRIVACY { VOICE_PRIVACY_STANDARD = 0x01, VOICE_PRIVACY_ENHANCED = 0x02, VOICE_PRIVACY_UNAVAILABLE = 0xFF }
enum  eQMI_SUPS_TYPE {
  SUPS_TYPE_RELEASE_HELD_OR_WAITING = 0x01, SUPS_TYPE_RELEASE_ACTIVE_ACCEPT_HELD_OR_WAITING = 0x02, SUPS_TYPE_HOLD_ACTIVE_ACCEPT_WAITING_OR_HELD = 0x03, SUPS_TYPE_HOLD_ALL_EXCEPT_SPECIFIED_CALL = 0x04,
  SUPS_TYPE_MAKE_CONFERENCE_CALL = 0x05, SUPS_TYPE_EXPLICIT_CALL_TRANSFER = 0x06, SUPS_TYPE_CCBS_ACTIVATION = 0x07, SUPS_TYPE_END_ALL_CALLS = 0x08,
  SUPS_TYPE_RELEASE_SPECIFIED_CALL = 0x09
}

bool qmiCallStateToRILState ( enum eQMI_CALL_STATES  state,
RIL_CallState *  p_state 
)

Converts the call state information from QMI to RIL.

Parameters:
[in] state QMI call state information
[out] p_state converted RIL call state information
Returns:
true, if the call information is retrieved; false, otherwise
Abort:
none
Note:
none

Disconnect and End are grouped with active call, as there is no corresponding RIL state. RIL would disconnect the next time the call state changes (call ID would not be present)

size_t  datalen,
RIL_Token  t 
)

RIL_REQUEST_ANSWER Answer incoming call.

Parameters:
[in] data "data" is NULL
datalen length of the data parameter received
t token passed to the RIL command request
Returns:
none
Abort:
none
Note:
Will not be called for WAITING calls. RIL_REQUEST_SWITCH_WAITING_OR_HOLDING_AND_ACTIVE will be used in this case instead
void requestConference ( void *  data,
size_t  datalen,
RIL_Token  t 
)

RIL_REQUEST_CONFERENCE Conference holding and active (like AT+CHLD=3).

Parameters:
data "data" is NULL
datalen length of the data parameter received
t token passed to the RIL command request
Returns:
none
Abort:
none
Note:
none

Release the held call, and make the backgroud call active; if there are not any background calls no active calls would be present after this

void requestSeparateConnection ( void *  data,
size_t  datalen,
RIL_Token  t 
)

RIL_REQUEST_SEPARATE_CONNECTION Separate a party from a multiparty call placing the multiparty call (less the specified party) on hold and leaving the specified party as the only other member of the current (active) call.

Parameters:
[in] data data is an "int *" (int *)data)[0] contains Connection index (value of 'x' in CHLD above)
datalen length of the data parameter received
t token passed to the RIL command request
Returns:
none
Abort:
none
Note:
See TS 22.084 1.3.8.2 (iii) TS 22.030 6.5.5 "Entering "2X followed by send"

Release the held call, and make the backgroud call active; if there are not any background calls no active calls would be present after this

void VoiceCallInfoCallback ( voiceSetAllCallStatusCbkInfo *  pCallBackInfo  ) 

It Displays call information of all call in progress.

Parameters:
[in] pCallBackInfo All call state information
Returns:
none

Enqueue the function to send the usolicited response for the call state change. We do not require to send anything else as the GET_CURRENT_CALLS would be invoked subsequently to get the call information TBD - Need to decide whether we need to send the RING indication, as of now seems to be redundant as the CALL_STATE_CHANGED has to be sent anyway
